snippet: Witnesses to the shooting of a black teenager by a white police officer in Ferguson, Mo., have given investigators sharply conflicting accounts. Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. is scheduled to visit Wednesday.
abstract: County grand jury prepares to hear evidence in shooting death of black teenager Michael Brown by white police officer Darren Wilson that touched off 10 days of unrest in Ferguson, Mo; witnesses have given investigators sharply conflicting accounts of the killing; new details on witness accounts emerge as Atty Gen Eric H Holder Jr is scheduled to visit to meet with FBI agents who have been conducting civil rights investigation into shooting.

byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: Frances Robles reported from Ferguson, and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Matt Apuzzo from Washington, Marc Santora from New York, and Alan Blinder and John Eligon from Ferguson.

lead_paragraph: Witnesses to the shooting of a black teenager by a white police officer in Ferguson, Mo., have given investigators sharply conflicting accounts. Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. is scheduled to visit Wednesday.

headline.main: Shooting Accounts Differ as Holder Schedules Visit to Ferguson
headline.print_headline: Shooting Accounts Differ as Holder Schedules Visit
